record.Title: What is Data Analysis
record.Desc: Data analysis is the process of inspecting, cleansing, transforming, and modeling data to discover useful information hidden in the disorganized data. The information uncovered helps support conclusions and decision-making. While raw data has a lot of potential, we need data analytics to unlock the benefits and power behind the raw data. This overview level course provides a general overview of data analysis. This course is appropriate for the professional at any organizational level.
record.Keywords: data analysis,information gathering,pivot table,correlation,regression analysis,t-test,statistical analysis,Nano,Micro,10 minute,ten minute,$ENHANCEDKEYWORDS Checkpoint Learning Computer Software and Applications Technology Nano Learning iPad Online Online (Nano-Learning/10 Min) Anne Marie Girolami

record.Title: TCJA and Increased Standard Deduction and Changes to Credits and Deductions
record.Desc: The Tax Cuts and Jobs Act made substantial changes to the Tax Code, particularly for individuals. Substantial changes were made to deductions and credits available to individuals, including the standard deduction, medical expense, mortgage interest, state and local taxes, charitable deductions, moving expenses, 2% itemized deductions, as well as personal casualty losses, child and nondependent credits.
record.Keywords: TCJA,individuals,medical expense,mortgage interest limits,state and local taxes,personal casualty losses,2% itemized deductions,child credit,nondependent credit,charitable deductions,moving expenses,nano,$ENHANCEDKEYWORDS Checkpoint Learning Taxes Taxation Nano Learning iPad Online Online (Nano-Learning/10 Min) Melissa Vance; Practitioners Publishing Company

record.Title: Cafeteria Plan Nondiscrimination Rules: Design and Testing Fundamentals
record.Desc: The Code's nondiscrimination rules for cafeteria plans prevent discrimination in favor of individuals who are highly compensated or otherwise key to the plan sponsor's business—and favorable tax treatment for these individuals requires compliance with the nondiscrimination rules. This webinar will help employers, service providers, and advisors understand and navigate the various requirements and avoid problems through monitoring and plan design. You can also register for our separate webinar on nondiscrimination rules for health flexible spending arrangements (FSAs) and dependent care assistance programs (DCAPs), offered on June 11, 2020.
record.Keywords: cafeteria, Section 125, nondiscrimination, testing, webinar, EW203T, EW203RT, webinar supplement, recording, recorded, EBIA,$ENHANCEDKEYWORDS EBIA Webinar Supplement Webinar Supplement Practice Aid (PA)

record.Title: Waste and Abuse in Government Expenditures
record.Desc: The determination of waste and abuse is subjective. Auditors aren't required to plan their audit to find waste and abuse, but if during the scope of inquiries and testing you become aware of something that smells like abuse or waste, then you are responsible for going ahead and delving down deeper. This is particularly important in government engagements. This course looks at identifying waste and abuse in governmental expenditures. Not all state boards accept nano-learning courses for CPE credit. Please verify that your state board accepts nano-learning courses for CPE credit.
record.Keywords: nano,micro learning,GAO,state and local government,fraud,waste,abuse,Yellow Book,travel and entertainment,expenditures,10 minutes,$ENHANCEDKEYWORDS Checkpoint Learning Auditing (Governmental) Accounting & Auditing Nano Learning iPad Online Online (Nano-Learning/10 Min) Lee Ann Watters

record.Title: Reviewing Board of Directors' Meeting Minutes
record.Desc: Every company must record the minutes of all proceedings of general meetings, meetings of the Board of Directors, and every committee meeting of the Board. They are stored in books kept for that purpose. Minute books are statutory books, and external auditors are required to read all Board of Directors' meeting minutes. They often contain information related to the financial statements, committees' activities and decisions, and any subsequent events that occurred that may have a significant impact on the assessment of internal control over financial reporting. This overview level course provides a general review of Board of Directors' minute meetings from a broad perspective. This course is appropriate for the professional at any organizational level.
record.Keywords: Board of Directors meeting minutes,external audit review,committee meeting minutes,meeting minutes contents,BOD,meeting minutes,Nano,Micro,10 minute,ten minute,$ENHANCEDKEYWORDS Checkpoint Learning Auditing Accounting & Auditing Nano Learning iPad Online Online (Nano-Learning/10 Min) Anne Marie Girolami

record.Title: What is a Peer Review
record.Desc: A peer review is a periodic external review of a firm's quality control system in accounting and auditing. The AICPA requires its member firms to undergo a peer review every three years, if the firm performs services within the scope of the peer review standards and issues reports in accordance with AICPA professional standards. This overview may be appropriate for professionals at all organizational levels.
record.Keywords: peer review, engagement review, system review,Nano,Micro,10 minute,ten minute,$ENHANCEDKEYWORDS Checkpoint Learning Auditing Accounting & Auditing Nano Learning iPad Online Online (Nano-Learning/10 Min) Anne Marie Girolami

record.Title: Form 5500 for Health and Welfare Plans: Preparation and Filing
record.Desc: Form 5500 failures can trigger some of the toughest penalties in employee benefits law—making careful compliance a must for plan sponsors, service providers, and advisors. Our annual webinar explains the filing obligation and walks you through the actual form for the 2019 plan year, highlighting the health and welfare requirements, potential pitfalls, and any changes from the 2018 Form.

record.Title: Nuts and Bolts of HIPAA Uses and Disclosures
record.Desc: In this webinar, we’ll demystify HIPAA’s detailed rules governing use and disclosure of protected health information (PHI) by group health plans, plan sponsors, and business associates. We’ll review the definitions of covered entities and business associates and what is—and is not—PHI. We’ll discuss uses and disclosures for payment and health care operations—along with special conditions for disclosures to plan sponsors. We’ll explain the uses and disclosures that require individual authorizations. We’ll conclude with a discussion of breach notification requirements that may be triggered by improper uses or disclosures PHI.
record.Keywords: webinar, recorded, EBIA, Nuts and Bolts, HIPAA, Disclosures, PHI, health plans, sponsors, individual authorization, breach notification, recording ,$ENHANCEDKEYWORDS EBIA Webinar Supplement Webinar Supplement Other

record.Title: HRAs in 2020: A Brave New World for Defined Contribution Health Care
record.Desc: This session will begin with a historical perspective on HRAs, including options and limitations for HRAs today, and will then focus on the agencies’ final regulations for HRAs (issued in June 2019). Topics covered will include the two new types of HRAs, other aspects of the regulations, and related compliance issues. Action items will be discussed, including compliance and plan design decisions and other implementation issues.
record.Keywords: webinar, live, EBIA, HRA, plan design, health plans, final regulations, new HRA, compliance, 2020, recording,,$ENHANCEDKEYWORDS EBIA Webinar Supplement Webinar Supplement Practice Aid (PA)

record.Title: Required Notices for Group Health Plans: Update Your Inventory Before 2020
record.Desc: What do you need to send—to whom, and when? There is a long list of notice requirements for group health plans—and your roster of health plan-related notices is probably due for a check-up. We’ll use a calendar-based and event-based approach to highlight the key notices group health plans will need to have ready for the coming plan year.
record.Keywords: webinar, live, EBIA, Required Notices, group health plans, health plans, inventory of notices, compliance check, 2020, recording,,$ENHANCEDKEYWORDS EBIA Webinar Supplement Webinar Supplement Practice Aid (PA)

record.Title: Perspectives on Current Design Trends: Reference-Based Pricing, Ancillary Benefits, and Specialty Providers
record.Desc: Creative approaches to managing health care can create challenging issues for plan sponsors and advisors. In this webinar, we will explore recent design trends for various health and consumer-driven health care plans. Topics will include the implementation of reference-based pricing structures by plans, as well as recent trends in ancillary benefits and issues arising with specialty service providers.

record.Title: DOL Investigations: Tips and Best Practices
record.Desc: Are you prepared if the DOL comes knocking? In this webinar we will cover the DOL’s enforcement authority and priorities, and explain the audit process including types of documents and information normally requested, on-site interviews, and types of closing letters. Our speakers will offer practical tips to help you be prepared to present an effective response.

record.Desc: As we gear up for the next round of Form 1094/1095 reporting by large employers and providers of coverage, we’ll be ready to walk you through the 2019 forms and instructions and agency guidance. Tune in to hear our experts share their insights on open issues, best practices, and practical tips for 2019 reporting.

record.Title: Wellness Programs: Practical Tips and Tricky Issues
record.Desc: This challenging subset of benefits - encompassing educational programs, physical fitness encouragement, health questionnaires, biometric tests, and more - continues to be in the spotlight. We’ll analyze the ever-evolving regulatory landscape, including the current status of the ADA and GINA incentive limits. Speakers will offer strategies for employers and service providers seeking compliance guidance amid uncertain legal standards.

record.Title: Top 10 Employee Benefit Pitfalls and How to Navigate Them
record.Desc: With employee benefit plans subject to so many complicated rules, it can be easy to run into challenges, often inadvertently. Our speakers will highlight some common pitfalls and offer practical advice on how to address them. Topics covered will include plan documentation issues, disclosure and communication problems, group health plan reporting and other compliance errors, and tricky Medicare issues.

record.Title: Learning the Ropes: An Introduction to COBRA Continuation Coverage
record.Desc: Our “Learning the Ropes” series is the perfect tool for training new staff or a quick refresher for yourself! COBRA violations are frequent fodder for litigation by former employees, so it’s crucial that all individuals involved in COBRA administration—employers, administrators, and advisors—understand the rules and the importance of being able to demonstrate the plan’s compliance. We’ll explain the COBRA basics, as well as some practical tips for reducing liability exposure.

record.Title: Learning the Ropes: An Introduction to HRAs and HSAs
record.Desc: Our “Learning the Ropes” series is the perfect tool for training new staff or a quick refresher for yourself! As a crucial design feature in consumer-driven health care programs, health reimbursement arrangements (HRAs) and health savings accounts (HSAs) have become increasingly common in the workplace. Basic training on HRAs and HSAs is important whether your company sponsors employee benefits, supplies administrative services, or provides compliance advice.

record.Title: Learning the Ropes: An Introduction to Cafeteria Plan Design & Administration
record.Desc: Our “Learning the Ropes” series is the perfect tool for training new staff or a quick refresher for yourself! Cafeteria plans are one of the most popular benefits around, allowing employees to buy coverage with pre-tax dollars while employers save on taxes, too. These tax advantages are subject to detailed compliance rules, however, and proper training for individuals new to cafeteria plan administration is critical. Whether you are a plan sponsor, TPA, or advisor to cafeteria plans, this webinar introduces the basics, with practical tips and examples to help illustrate the rules.

record.Title: ERISA Fiduciary Duties for Third-Party Administrators and Other Service Providers
record.Desc: Fiduciaries have a special status under ERISA. Sometimes that’s good, and sometimes that’s bad. The key is to know when you are—or may be—acting as a fiduciary, and what your obligations are both as a fiduciary and as a non-fiduciary service provider. This program will discuss key concepts and issues for TPAs and other service providers under ERISA’s fiduciary duty and prohibited transaction rules, including when someone is a fiduciary, what it means to be a fiduciary, and why even non-fiduciary service providers must be mindful of how they structure their service agreements and compensation.
record.Keywords: EW225T, webinar, live, EBIA, ERISA, fiduciary, fiduciaries, service provider, service provider agreement, 2, TPA ,$ENHANCEDKEYWORDS EBIA Webinar Supplement Webinar Supplement Practice Aid (PA)

record.Title: Group Health Plan Eligibility: Design Decisions and Compliance Audits
record.Desc: Group health plans must define which employees—and family members—are eligible for coverage. How has health care reform influenced plan eligibility design decisions? What flexibility remains? And how can employers, administrators, and their advisors be sure that only eligible individuals participate in the plan? Auditing health plan eligibility data and processes can yield cost savings, enhance compliance, and improve overall plan administration—but audits must be conducted without running afoul of health care reform’s prohibition on rescissions of coverage. Our experts will help plan sponsors, service providers, and advisors evaluate the pros and cons, understand the logistics and legal issues, and implement effective eligibility audits for employer health plans.
record.Keywords: recording, EW143RT, Eligibility, rescission, health plan compliance, dependent eligibility, EW143T, webinar, EBIA, Compliance Audits,$ENHANCEDKEYWORDS EBIA Webinar Supplement Webinar Supplement Practice Aid (PA)

record.Title: Common Mistakes and How to Fix Them: Cafeteria Plans, Health FSAs, and DCAPs
record.Desc: The administration of cafeteria plans, health FSAs, and DCAPs presents many opportunities for mistakes—election mistakes, overpayments, incorrect salary withholding. We’ll walk through examples of common mistakes and discuss how to find, fix, and even prevent them.
record.Keywords: Cafeteria, dependent care, FSA, flexible spending, DCAP, webinar, EBIA, EW151RT,$ENHANCEDKEYWORDS EBIA Webinar Supplement Webinar Supplement Practice Aid (PA)

record.Title: Governmental and Church Group Health Plans: What Rules Apply?
record.Desc: Which plans fit within ERISA’s exemption for governmental and church plans? We’ll consider quasi-governmental entities, and the latest litigation narrowing the church plan definition. For plans that do fit within these definitions, what does ERISA exemption mean—must these plans comply with state law? And how do the Affordable Care Act and other federal laws apply to governmental and church plans? We’ll walk you through the legal landscape and answer your tricky questions during a Q&A session; you can also submit questions in advance!
record.Keywords: Public sector; church plan; ERISA exemption, non-federal governmental, EW188RT, webinar, supplement, recording, EBIA,$ENHANCEDKEYWORDS EBIA Webinar Supplement Webinar Supplement Practice Aid (PA)

record.Title: Learning the Ropes: An Introduction to HIPAA Privacy & Security
record.Desc: Our “Learning the Ropes” series is the perfect tool for training new staff or a quick refresher for yourself! The latest enforcement activity—and constant breach threats—make HIPAA privacy and security compliance more important than ever. Designed for plan sponsors, TPAs, advisors, and other business associates, this webinar delivers the basics on HIPAA’s privacy, security, and breach notification rules. Combine it with your organization-specific HIPAA policies and procedures, and you can satisfy HIPAA’s training requirement for workforce members who handle protected health information.
record.Keywords: HIPAA, breach, business associate, protected health information, PHI, EW193T, recording, EW193RT,$ENHANCEDKEYWORDS EBIA Webinar Supplement Webinar Supplement Practice Aid (PA)

record.Title: Medicare Check-Up for Group Health Plans
record.Desc: Medicare can affect employer-sponsored group health plans in a variety of ways. For plan sponsors, plan administrators, and service providers, this webinar will address Medicare questions you didn’t know you needed to ask. Topics covered will include the Medicare Secondary Payer (MSP) rules and coordination of benefits issues, HSA-disqualifying coverage, Medicare Part D creditable coverage and disclosure requirements, and more.
record.Keywords: recording, EBIA, employee benefits, group health plans, Medicare, EW238RT, 2, specialized knowledge,,$ENHANCEDKEYWORDS EBIA Webinar Supplement Webinar Supplement Practice Aid (PA)

record.Title: Claims and Appeals Rules for Group Health and Disability Plans: Translating Rules into Best Practices
record.Desc: Mishandled claims and appeals frequently lead to litigation. While many employers turn to third-party claims administrators to carry out some or all of these functions, in most cases the employer retains legal responsibility. For employers with self-insured group health plans, responsibility for complying with the claims and appeals rules generally falls on the employer as plan administrator. And disability plans are subject to additional rules, which were revised in 2018. Join our instructors for an analysis of the legal framework as well as strategies for managing the practical challenges.
record.Keywords: Claims, appeals, ERISA, DOL, litigation, TPA, fiduciary, disability, Affordable Care Act, ACA, EBIA, webinar, EW201RT, specialized knowledge, 2, webinar recording,$ENHANCEDKEYWORDS EBIA Webinar Supplement Webinar Supplement Practice Aid (PA)

record.Title: Companion to PPC's Guide to Preparing Nonprofit Financial Statements - Course 1 - The Statement of Activities (NFSTG201)
record.Desc: This interactive self-study course takes a look at the statement of activities prepared by nonprofit organizations. Lesson 1 covers basic form and style considerations for this statement, as well as guidance on how to address contributions, organizations that raise contributions for others, and noncash contributions. Les- son 2 discusses revenues from exchange transactions, investment returns, gains and losses, the reclassification of net assets, reporting expenses by function, and other items that are required to be presented separately. Finally, Lesson 3 provides guidance on the accounting and presentation of certain expenses and the presentation of taxes.
record.Keywords: NFST20,NFSTG201,PPCs Guide to Preparing Nonprofit Financial Statements,statement of activities,$ENHANCEDKEYWORDS Checkpoint Learning Accounting Accounting & Auditing Print-Based Courses Print-Based with OG Correspondence

record.Title: Companion to PPC's Guide to Preparing Nonprofit Financial Statements - Course 2 - Form, Style, and the Statements of Functional Expenses and Cash Flows (NFSTG202)
record.Desc: This interactive self-study course discusses general form and style considerations as they relate to preparing financial statements for a nonprofit organization. In addition, authoritative literature and form and presentation considerations are covered for the statement of functional expenses and the statement of cash flows.
record.Keywords: NFST20,NFSTG202,PPCs Guide to Preparing Nonprofit Financial Statements,Statement of Functional Expenses,$ENHANCEDKEYWORDS Checkpoint Learning Accounting Accounting & Auditing Print-Based Courses Print-Based with OG Correspondence

record.Title: Companion to PPC's Guide to Preparing Financial Statements - Course 3 - Affiliated Organizations and Other Related Entities (NFSTG203)
record.Desc: This interactive self-study course explores several topics related to nonprofit organizations and their financial reporting relationships with other entities. Lesson 1 provides general accounting guidance for assessing reporting requirements with affiliated and related entities including mergers, acquisitions, and combined financial results. Lesson 2 examines consolidated, consolidating, and combined financial statement preparation and presentation and accounting for assets using the equity method.
record.Keywords: NFST20,NFSTG202,PPCs Guide to Preparing Nonprofit Financial Statements,$ENHANCEDKEYWORDS Checkpoint Learning Accounting Accounting & Auditing Print-Based Courses Print-Based with OG Correspondence

Thomson Reuters top priority is the health, safety and well-being of everyone we come in contact with. Hence, we are currently monitoring the COVID-19 (Coronavirus) situation as it develops. We rely on guidance from the World Health Organization and Centers for Disease Control and Prevention and will always follow the advice of local and national public health authorities, as they respond to the changing landscape we face. If there are changes to your in-person event as a result, we will notify you immediately. In addition, if your in-person event is later cancelled, you will have the option to move to a different in-person event, a virtual session, or receive a refund. We are currently developing our live virtual sessions to supplement the in-person options. We are constantly monitoring this situation and will continue to adapt as needed.

record.Title: AuditWatch University Customized In-House Seminar
record.Desc:
CUSTOMIZED TRAINING

Our goal is to enable the success of your firm. The staff development programs we present at AuditWatch University are based on the typical needs of most of our clients. Every firm is different and may have specific training needs unique to its own company challenges. Our instructors and development team have the experience and depth of knowledge to tailor our programs to meet your staff development needs.

Pricing for custom training development varies according to the complexity of the project. The lead time necessary to prepare the training materials depends on a number of variables, including the type of content that needs to be developed and the availability of resources. It is not uncommon for a development project to take several weeks.

If there is a possibility that your firm is considering a custom training course, contact AuditWatch as quickly as possible so that we plan accordingly.

To learn more about your customized training options call 800.775.9866.
